page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF PADBURY
page.content: In the original Domesday Padbury had a mill. Padbury Mill still exists, now as a private house, but it was a mill at the start of the century. The present building dates back several hundred years. The village contains many houses over 200 years old, some over 300. About 20 houses still have thatched roofs. Padbury has changed considerably over the last 10 years. There has been much infilling with new houses. Many of the older houses and barns have been refurbished to provide luxury homes, most of which are beyond the reach of ordinary families who have lived in the village for generations. However, some starter homes have recently been built and there is a council housing estate at one end of the village. A new school has been built and the future of the village seems assured.
